oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: Item 2 this morning, then, is a session with the Minister for Children and Social Care on the Welsh Government's childcare offer.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: So, I'm very pleased to welcome Huw Irranca-Davies, Minister for Children and Social Care, also Jo-Anne Daniels, director for communities and tackling poverty, and Owain Lloyd, deputy director for childcare, play and early years.

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: How has it gone in the early implementer local authority areas, and is it something of a mixed bag?

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: What is the administrative burden?

oracle_info.speaker: darren millar am
oracle_info.content: But they've raised concerns about the national living wage implications, haven't they, as well?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: No.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: They know that.

oracle_info.speaker: david rees am
oracle_info.content: In the situation regarding Welsh-medium, you answered that a little bit earlier, but I have concerns about capacity.

oracle_info.speaker: david rees am
oracle_info.content: Workforce capacity you've mentioned.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: That in itself, I have to say, is a worthy aim.

oracle_info.speaker: john griffiths am
oracle_info.content: They've talked about increasing the qualifications within the workforce, and the quality.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: The next questions are from Mark.

oracle_info.speaker: mark reckless am
oracle_info.content: I just wondered about the quality of this PPIW piece of work.

oracle_info.speaker: mark reckless am
oracle_info.content: And what is your early assessment of the income levels of families who are finding this offer most attractive?

specific_query_list.query: Summarize the discussion about the early implementer areas.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: It's gone well, but I'm glad we've done it through this process of early implementer, actually piloting it, because we're learning lessons as we go along.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: It has gone well.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: And the burden of administration on that is falling to each pilot area.

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: What is the administrative burden?

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: What specifically is that?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: It's not capacity, by the way.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Now that isn't what the scheme is about, by the way, I have to say.

specific_query_list.query: What were the two lessons that can be learned from early implementer areas?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: It's been encouraging, to the extent that we're at the point where we're expanding—we've made announcements on expanding some of the early implementer areas so we can learn more lessons.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: The two tie together.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: That's one important distinction.

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: How many of them are there?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Now, we did agonise a number of things that brought us to the conclusion where we are.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: This is about providing opportunities for all working families.

oracle_info.speaker: david rees am
oracle_info.content: Workforce capacity you've mentioned.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: First of all, this is being—.

oracle_info.speaker: llyr gruffydd am
oracle_info.content: So, it wasn't a question after all.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: There are niceties within this as well; it doesn't have to be that both parents are working.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: So, there is some flexibility within this scheme as well to deal with some of those disadvantaged families.

oracle_info.speaker: lynne neagle am
oracle_info.content: The next questions are from Mark.

specific_query_list.query: Why the intensity of demands for the services in the early implementer areas would not be spread across Wales?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: If we were doing this tomorrow, it would cause a problem, but what we're learning is that there are some economic issues and then there are some cultural issues.

specific_query_list.query: Summarize the discussion about the childcare offer.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Unregistered grandparents?

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: And what about the view, given that you said that capacity wasn't an issue, of the National Day Nurseries Association, which says that Wales has the most fragile childcare sector in Great Britain?

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: That's fair enough, but is it realistic to think that there's going to be capacity growth in the next two to three years to deliver the product?

specific_query_list.query: What did Barry Hughes think about the registration of grandparents when talking about childcare offer?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: The childcare offer isn't only to just provide childcare; it's the wider aspects that come with this.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: That's one important distinction.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: So, the focus of this scheme is very much on registered licensed providers, which could be, by the way—because we do have them, and we're discussing this at the moment internally and with the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years and others—grandparents who are actually registered and inspected by the care inspectorate?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: We haven't got the exact number, but we don't think they are huge numbers, but there are, in our constituencies, registered, licensed, inspected grandparents who look after other people's children in a little group of four or five or six or seven, but also their own grandchildren.

specific_query_list.query: What did Huw Irranca-Davies think about the capacity in the next several years to deliver the product when talking about childcare offer?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: ', which is encouraging.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: It's not capacity, by the way.

oracle_info.speaker: hefin david am
oracle_info.content: That's fair enough, but is it realistic to think that there's going to be capacity growth in the next two to three years to deliver the product?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: We know that there is a shortage in parts of Wales for Welsh language childcare development.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: One of the defining hallmarks of the way that we've taken this scheme forward is learning in live time as we pilot and expand the pilots into different areas and different types of provision.

specific_query_list.query: Summarize the discussion about hourly rates of the service.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: We're reasonably assured by the feedback that we're having that the £4.50 might work as a universal amount.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: This is about providing opportunities for all working families.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: One of the defining hallmarks of the way that we've taken this scheme forward is learning in live time as we pilot and expand the pilots into different areas and different types of provision.

oracle_info.speaker: david rees am
oracle_info.content: In your answer to John, you talked about affordability, which I totally understand.

specific_query_list.query: What did Huw Irranca-Davies think about the affordability of lowest-income working families when talking about hourly rates of the service?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: We're reasonably assured by the feedback that we're having that the £4.50 might work as a universal amount.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: The fact that parents, including those who are on lower incomes, are used to currently discriminating between providers, not only with childcare settings but also within school settings as well, where very often schools now will say, 'We're doing something extra'—

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: But within what we have, I think this works very, very well indeed, because it's very transparent for parents who are used to making these decisions.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Well, possibly you would.

specific_query_list.query: What did Huw Irranca-Davies think about the pilots in Cardiff and Newport?

oracle_info.speaker: mark reckless am
oracle_info.content: But you're not piloting it in any of the high-cost areas that I've referred to.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Cardiff and Newport—September.

oracle_info.speaker: owain lloyd
oracle_info.content: This September.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: And if you are right, that it's more expensive, and we need a higher rate within those areas, then we're going to have to come back and discuss it with the committee.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: But let's go in and learn it first of all, rather than assume it necessarily.

specific_query_list.query: Summarize the discussion about the impact on children.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Those will be some of those most disadvantaged families that we both have those concerns about.

oracle_info.speaker: john griffiths am
oracle_info.content: They've talked about increasing the qualifications within the workforce, and the quality.

specific_query_list.query: What did Huw Irranca-Davies think about the Flying Start scheme when talking about the impact on children?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Yes, but the fact that Flying Start, we know, is leading to those outcomes where those children, in quite challenged circumstances very often, are more ready to step up to the foundation year, are more ready, then, to step through into mainstream education in later years—those things tie together.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: So, there are the 10 hours of education provision that sits here for every family, by the way, within this offer, let alone the childcare.

oracle_info.speaker: llyr gruffydd am
oracle_info.content: The majority of disadvantaged children don't live in Flying Start areas, do they?

specific_query_list.query: How did Huw Irranca-Davies ensure the high qualification and quality of the workforce while the rates remained at £4.50?

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Their standard of staff was an exemplar of what we'd want to see: not only very well-qualified childcare staff who were qualified within not simply the child-minding but the wider child development aspects—.

oracle_info.speaker: huw irranca-davies am
oracle_info.content: Now, that is the model we need to see, and the £4.50 seems to work, at the moment, for that.
